greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Convolution square root of A000521.
comment: Triangle A161362 = the corresponding convolution triangle with row sums = A000521.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..426
formula: Given A000521: (j = 1/q + 744 + 196884q + 21493760q^2 + 864299970q^3 + ...); multiply by q and take the convolution square root.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (4 t)) = f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, May 03 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(65536 + x*QPochhammer[-1, x]^24)^(3/2) / (4096 * QPochhammer[-1, x]^12), {x, 0, 20}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 23 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); A = x * (eta(x^2 + A) / eta(x + A))^24; polcoeff( sqrt(x * (1 + 256*A)^3 / A), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, May 03 2014 */
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 07 2009
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 15 2009
